subject: Re: Spiricom Device
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Yes, winamp works, but be sure and not set it it to convert all your 
files over to winamp files.  When I downloaded it a long time ago, I 
accidentally forgot to unmark that preference during the set-up and 
it converted every audio file on my computer to a winamp file.  

Not cool when you want to make them available for all to hear.  :)

LC 


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Wiliam Clarke <reesclarke_69@...> 
wrote:
>
> Try downloading WinAmp some reason it made mine open up.  I had the 
same problem.
>

been able to open any of the files that

> 
> kay
>

> > Debbie

> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wrote:
> > >
> > > I formally thought "hoax," too, until I found how easy it is 
for 
> > > ghosts/spirits, etc to use these different devices we have 
today 
> to 
> > > communicate through. 
> > > 
> > > It's almost as if the ability to talk to the other side has 
been 
> > > there the whole time, or better yet, that the other side has 
> been 
> > > communicating with us the whole time, but we simply needed to 
> > > become "awakened" to it...
> > > 
> > > LC
> > > 
> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Stefan Bion" <yahoogroups@> 
> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > When I first listened to the Spiricom samples several years 
> ago, 
> > my 
> > > immediate impression was: Hmm, it sounds like someone using 
> > > an "electronic larynx" (speech aid device). This impression was 
> > > strengthened by the observation that the buzzing sound often 
was 
> > even 
> > > modulated by O'Neill's own voice during the dialoges between 
him 
> > > and "Dr. Mueller"! (Did O'Neill forget to remove the device 
from 
> > his 
> > > throat while talking to his counterpart?)
> > > > 
> > > > And what about the "13 frequencies" that are supposed to be 
> used 
> > as 
> > > the "carrier" for the spirit voices? Why aren't they audible in 
> the 
> > > recordings? And why does a mixture of the 13 tones created with 
> > > Audition sound so different from the typical "Spiricom buzz"? - 
> > Well, 
> > > if you analyze the frequency spectrum of the buzzing sound 
(this 
> > can 
> > > be done with Audition etc.), you will find a lot of harmonics 
> > (peaks 
> > > in the spectrum), and some of these harmonics more or less 
match 
> > the 
> > > 13 Spiricom frequencies...
> > > > 
> > > > To me, the entire Spiricom saga produces more questions than 
> > > answers...
> > > > 
> > > > ----- original Nachricht --------
> > > > 
> > > > Betreff: [EVP-ITC] Re: Spirico Device
> > > > Gesendet: Fr, 18. Apr 2008
> > > > Von: alexrondini<alexrondini@>
> > > > 
> > > > > Thanks Guy, I have heard a few people mention that O'Neil 
> > hoaxed 
> > > it 
> > > > > but I don't know enough about this to really pass any sort 
> of 
> > > > > judgement. Looking forward to seeing your website.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Alex
> > > > > 
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Guy" <yzzzguy@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > In regards to the Spiricom story - I have to assume 
you're 
> > > referring to 
> > > > > > the Mark IV model as diagrammed/written up in the 
Spiricom 
> > > manual (as 
> > > > > > opposed to the INCORRECT diagram made by Polish 
researcher 
> > > Wojciech 
> > > > > > Drewniak...http://www.worlditc.org/k_06_spiricom.htm ).
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > While my research is still not finished (and I've been 
> > working 
> > > on this 
> > > > > > for a little over 2 years), I'm leaning toward the Mark 
IV 
> > > > > > conversations as having been hoaxed by Bill O'Neil. 
> HOWEVER - 
> > I 
> > > believe 
> > > > > > he acted alone and that none of the other members of the 
> > > Metascience 
> > > > > > Foundation were involved with this hoax. As to O'Neil's 
> > > motivation for 
> > > > > > the hoax - I still don't know. But I will also say that 
> the 
> > > veridical 
> > > > > > evidence that O'Neil claims to have received about Dr. 
> George 
> > > J. 
> > > > > > Mueller through clairaudience is amazing and it is tough 
> to 
> > see 
> > > how 
> > > > > > O'Neil would have gotten this information given his 
> finances, 
> > > location, 
> > > > > > the timeframe, etc.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > I've been promising to get my personal website up and 
> > operating 
> > > for 
> > > > > > some time now but have been busy. Hopefully soon. Then 
> I'll 
> > > start 
> > > > > > posting what I have found out so far.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Guy Jackson
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > P.S. The recordings of the Spiricom cassette that can be 
> > found 
> > > at the 
> > > > > > GOS website ( 
> > http://www.ghostpix.com/spiricom/spiricom.html ) 
> > > are very 
> > > > > > poor. Scott L over at Ghostly Talk pulled much a much 
> cleaner 
> > > version 
> > > > > > directly from a source cassette provided to him by Mark 
> Macy 
> > ( 
> > > see 
> > > > > > Ghostly Talk show archive noted as a "Bonus" and "Repost" 
> for

> > > > > > 22, 2006: http://www.ghostlytalk.com/node/616 ).
